column2: JOB   DESCRIPTION Job   Title:  Customer Service Officer (CSO) Department:  Direct Lending 1.  JOB   PURPOSE: The CSOs primary job role is addition of customer and increasing sustainable portfolio  for the branch. CSO is to identify new business locations, sourcing and addition of  potential customers. Post disbursement he/she has to collect the installments on  scheduled dates from the customers. 2.  REPORTING   TO:  Branch Head 3.  PRINCIPAL   ACCOUNTABILITIES: Accountabilities   Activities Business Development and 1. Is required to meet disbursement targets month-  Monitoring onmonth as prescribed by HO/RM/BH.  2. Provide entry point for the company in new village locations. 3. Conduct primary survey of new village locations as  per process prescribed by HO using VIS. 4. Propose the identified villages to BH/CSE. 5. Source and on-board customers into NABFINS as  per process. 6. Contact the customers for scheduled disbursement  dates and ensure their presence. 7. Enter all required details of the customer application,  etc in the CMS as required. 8. Ensuring other work as directed by HO. Customer Addition and Portfolio 1. He/She is to ensure timely collection of all customers Management allotted to him.  2. He/She is to ensure that cash collected is deposited  in the bank on the same day. 3. He/She is to ensure that all collection and  remittance entries are updated on daily basis as  directed by HO. 4. He/She is to ensure that disbursement entries and  receipt entries are done as and when required. 5. Report on any overdue collections on daily basis to  BH/CSE. 6. Follow up with any pending collection from default  customers. 7. Identify proper customers through field visits and  interaction. 8. Ensure that there is minimum dormancy in his  portfolio. 9. Conduct any additional customer addition process as  instructed by HO. Business Administration and 1. Has to assist branch management in branch setup Manpower management and administrative requirements for branches. Training and Process Review 1. Participate in training scheduled in the branch. 2. Must ensure all his customers have knowledge of  NABFINS process and other grievance mechanisms. MIS and Daily reporting 1. Provide her/his day work data to BH/CSE daily. 2. Escalate necessary information to BH/CSE/RM/HO  for any deviations observed. 3. Use necessary data from CMS or daily activity to  monitor her/his portfolio efficiency and achieve  target parameters. Compliance and Quality  development 1. Ensure quality parameters in her/his portfolio for  loan documentation. 2. Maintain process and documentation check as  guided by RM/HO/Audit team. 3. Ensure process implementation and  reduce deviations. 4. Provide compliance on deviations observed in  her/his portfolio. People Management and Team development 1. Responsible for upkeep of company vision and best  practices in his region. 2. Provide a mentoring role to her/his juniors.3. Conduct Training to employees as per directions of HO. *The above mentioned job role is subjected to changes on direction of HO as per business  requirement. 3. Regular visits to the JLGs as per the work plan Maintain transparency in the working of the JLGs. PERFORMANCE   EVALUATION   Financial   Dimensions Growth in Business (credit disbursement and recovery, Overdue/ NPA position, New Business development,  Repeat Loans disbursement) Other   Dimensions (qualitative assessment) Monitoring of the JLGs, pro-active initiatives (credit+ activities, identification of new business opportunities,  etc.) 6.   SKILLS   AND   KNOWLEDGE   Educational   Qualifications Minimum   qualification   PUC/10+2   completed. Must   have   written,   spoken   and   reading   command   over   local   language   and   English. Drivers   License   and   Motorcycle   is   a   must. column1: Sales Executive For Mutual Funds, PMS, and Wealth Management Products
column2: Responsibilities: 1. Develop and execute sales strategies to promote mutual funds, PMS, and wealth management products to potential clients. 2. Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients while actively seeking opportunities for upselling and cross-selling. 3. Conduct thorough financial needs assessments to understand clients' investment objectives, risk tolerance, and time horizon. 4. Provide personalized investment advice and recommendations tailored to each client's unique financial situation. 5. Collaborate with internal teams, including portfolio managers and research analysts, to stay updated on market trends and investment opportunities. 6. Stay informed about regulatory changes and compliance requirements related to mutual funds and wealth management products. 7. Prepare and deliver presentations, proposals, and reports to clients, highlighting the benefits and features of various investment products. 8. Attend industry events, seminars, and conferences to network with potential clients and stay abreast of industry developments. 9. Meet or exceed sales targets and performance metrics set by the organization. 10. Continuously strive to enhance product knowledge and sales skills through training programs and self-study. Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field. 2. 3-5 years of experience in sales, preferably in the financial services industry with a focus on mutual funds, PMS, or wealth management products. 3. Strong understanding of financial markets, investment products, and asset allocation strategies. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with clients. 5. Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth. 6. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment. 7. Proficiency in MS Office applications, especially PowerPoint and Excel. 8. Relevant certifications such as AMFI, NISM, or CFP would be an advantage. Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile  - the ideal candidate should possess strong communication skills, a deep understanding of financial markets, and a passion for helping clients achieve their investment goals.

column2: Role & responsibilities     1. Assessing and evaluating the creditworthiness of pre-owned car loan applicants based on credit history, financial statements, and other relevant financial data to determine their eligibility for loan approval. 2. Managing the credit underwriting process, including the analysis of credit risk, loan-to-value ratios, and repayment capacity, to make informed decisions on loan approvals and credit limits for pre owned car financing. 3. Collaborating with the sales and marketing teams to identify potential customers, conduct customer evaluations, and provide guidance on credit terms, loan structures, and financing options for pre-owned car purchases. 4. Conducting thorough due diligence on loan applications, including verification of customer information, collateral valuation, and legal documentation, to ensure compliance with internal credit policies and regulatory requirements. 5. Reviewing and analyzing market trends, industry benchmarks, and customer credit profiles to develop and refine credit policies, risk assessment frameworks, and loan approval criteria for pre-owned car financing. 6. Managing the portfolio quality of pre-owned car loans, monitoring loan performance, and implementing strategies for minimizing credit losses and delinquencies within the assigned area of responsibility. 7. Providing guidance and support to the sales and credit teams on credit-related inquiries, customer negotiations, and loan structuring to facilitate the efficient and effective processing of pre-owned car loan applications. 8. Ensuring compliance with regulatory guidelines, internal policies, and industry best practices related to credit assessment, risk management, and loan approval processes for pre-owned car financing. 9. Providing regular reports and updates to senior management on the performance of the pre-owned car financing portfolio, key credit metrics, and recommended actions to optimize credit risk management and portfolio profitability within the designated area. 10. Collaborating with internal audit and compliance teams to facilitate audits, inspections, and reviews of credit processes, ensuring adherence to audit requirements and the implementation of corrective actions as needed. Preferred candidate profile    1. Educational Qualification: A bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or a related field is preferred. A master's degree or relevant certifications in credit analysis or risk management can be advantageous.  2. Experience: 5-7 years of experience in credit management, risk assessment, or lending operations, with a focus on pre-owned car financing, preferably in the financial services industry. 3. Analytical Abilities: Strong analytical skills to assess credit risk, interpret financial data, and make informed decisions on loan approvals and credit limits for pre-owned car financing.  4. Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, external stakeholders, and customers to facilitate the credit assessment and loan approval processes.  5. Attention to Detail: A keen eye for detail and accuracy in evaluating customer information, financial statements, and collateral documentation to ensure compliance with credit policies and regulatory requirements.  6. Leadership Skills: Strong leadership and team management abilities to effectively lead and mentor a team of credit professionals and drive a culture of excellence and risk management within the area of responsibility.  Locations: Ambala, Chandigarh, Hissar, Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Panipat, Sonipat, Lucknow, Jodhpur

column2: Job Title:   Business Analyst (Fixed Income SME) Location:  Remote(Or work from our office in Bhubaneswar) Salary:  Based on competency Required Skills (Domain): 5+ Years of Domain experience in CAPITAL MARKETS (Fund Accounting, Investment Management) Must possess in-depth understanding of fixed income accrual conventions such as day count basis, amortization methods, and business day conventions, including their impact on cash flow and ledger. Proficiency in various fixed income instruments/Derivatives including ILB, CFD, TRS, CDS etc.  and their valuation. Basic knowledge of market forces affecting bonds and the related corporate actions(Impairments/Write-downs etc.). Understanding of fixed income instruments with embedded options. Add-On Skills (Domain): Basic knowledge of MBS/ABS, including concepts like paydowns/payups, and variable rate mortgages. Understanding of interest capitalization processes. Familiarity with special processing for TIPs conventions, deflation protection, and Canadian accrual conventions. Knowledge of ETFs and Private Equities. Required Skills (Technical): Strong grasp of database concepts to understand data models and must have proficiency in SQL. Code Comprehension: Ability to read and understand code, identifying logic blocks and their purposes.  Must have hands-on experience working in agile software delivery teams with knowledge of GIT/Jira/Confluence Add-On Skills (Technical): Experience in writing complex SQL queries, including the use of joins, sub-queries and groupings. Knowledge of or experience in Investment Management products such as Eagle STAR/PACE, InvestOne etc. Good understanding of QA processes and hands on experience of testing/triaging/debugging.  Having good documentation skills to write BRD/FRD and release notes. Our extensive experience helps clients bring to life their business and technology operations, as well as gain the most value from their ongoing investments in technology.  This is what you will get: Competitive compensation package. A close and informal relation with the clients team (We are treated as the extension of the project  team of our client). column2: Job Title: Area Sales Manager - Business Loans (DSA Channel) Job Summary:  As an Area Sales Manager specializing in Business Loans through the Direct Selling Agent (DSA) channel, your primary responsibility will be to drive business loan sales within the designated area. You will be tasked with building and managing a team of DSAs, fostering relationships with business owners, and ensuring the timely and efficient processing of loan applications. Your goal will be to meet and exceed sales targets while maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities: Team Leadership:  Recruit, train, and motivate a team of DSAs to achieve sales targets and deliver exceptional customer service. Business Development:  Identify opportunities for business loan sales within the designated area, including targeting specific industries and businesses. Relationship Management:  Build and maintain strong relationships with business owners, financial institutions, and other relevant stakeholders to generate leads and drive business growth. Loan Processing:  Oversee the end-to-end loan application process, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in documentation, verification, and approval stages. Compliance:  Ensure adherence to all regulatory requirements and company policies throughout the sales and loan processing lifecycle. Performance Monitoring:  Implement performance metrics and tracking systems to monitor the productivity and effectiveness of the DSA team. Market Intelligence:  Stay updated on market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to inform sales strategies and product offerings. Training and Development:  Provide ongoing training and support to DSAs to enhance their product knowledge, sales techniques, and customer relationship management skills. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field. MBA preferred. Proven experience in sales management, preferably in the financial services sector with a focus on business loans. Strong leadership abilities with a track record of building and managing high-performing teams. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport with diverse clientele. Sound understanding of financial products, lending processes, and regulatory requirements. Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions. Result-oriented approach with a focus on achieving targets and driving business growth. Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software. Ticker Size:  20-70 Lakhs

Should be able to close the sales call by working closely with more experienced sales representative in case of need required 9. Responsible for maintaining the data of all the distributors assigned, find out the strategies to counter the competition in the market 10.Create awareness & for building brand by organizing events, conferences, product sessions for distributors for top-of-the-mind recall 11.Ensuring that the distributors are trained on all products and Operational procedures and Informed on the Regulatory Changes on regular basis 12.Soft skills training in terms of Communication, Motivation etc. for distributors specially for smaller / one man location 13.Coordination with the Admin/Finance team for any distributor payout in terms of creation and payment of all debit notes. Preferred candidate profile   min 1 year into sales - RD, ND, IIF Interested candidates can reach out me/drop resume -  7386568139 in whatsapp/call srinivas@avaniconsulting.com No charges.
